climbs.name: Mt Tucker
climbs.fa: Peter Green, Jack Lazar, Anna Berry, Sarah Wolf, Rubin Field, Jacob Case, Carson Fritz, Ben Mahorney, Jorge Reyes, Kyle Greenspan, Ransom Gravitt, Sie

content.description:
Travel up the shale ridge till you hit the head wall. Head right (SW) and walk to the sky line ridge. This is a good point to rope up (Some difficult scrambling/easy 5th with exposure). Follow ridge to the summit. Bring:
Cams to BD 2
lots of nutz

Hear up the rocky slope on the left till you reach the wall and can not continue to walk any higher. Traverse onto the glacier and go below the steep snow wall towards the lower grade crevasse covered area. Navigate through the crevasses (which can be time consuming) and you will find yourself on the summit ridge, Follow the left side of the ridge to the summit. Take a few pictures and prepare for an intimidating decent. 
 Note: 
 There is heli-skiing in this mountain so surpluses of large wands can be found near the summit, and can be useful for the decent. A few make a great deadman, and repelling will definitely speed things up.

Obvious peak. biggest in the range.
Pickets and a few Ice screws

Super fun route. Approach the base of the peak and head up the right most snow gully for a few hundred yards, then traverse the ridge line left to the summit. Great Exposure and awesome views. Peak was named for deceased Climber Torin Tucker.

From the base camp below the Skillet Glacier, Head down the north side of the valley until the peak is visible, at which point you climb it.
Anything
Beautiful range surrounding the Skillet Glacier
